titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Dorothy Hayden Cudahy and John J. Cudahy Family Papers AIA.001

did.unittitle: Dorothy Hayden Cudahy and John J. Cudahy Family Papers

physdesc.extent: in 15 record cartons, 1 manuscript box, 6 media boxes, 3 oversize flat boxes, and 27 oversize boxes.

controlaccess.subject: Irish Americans -- Music.
Irish Americans -- Social life and customs.
Saint Patrick's Day.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Materials in this series consists of newspaper clippings, correspondence, memoranda, material objects, and financial records documenting Dorothy Hayden Cudahy's personal and professional life, including her career in the New York City Department of Traffic, the Irish Memories radio program, her step dance troupe, and her involvement with various Irish and Irish American organizations. Of note are music playlists for the radio show and materials concerning Dorothy Cudahy's campaign to become the Grand Marshall of the New York St. Patrick's Day Parade.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of correspondence, financial records, newspaper editorials, and photographs concerning the life and interests of John J. Cudahy. Topics include Gaelic games matches, Cudahy's service in the United States Army during World War II, and his involvement in Irish and Irish American organizations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of photographs of individuals, groups, and events Dorothy Hayden Cudahy witnessed or participated in, including weddings, graduations, social gatherings, musical performances, events for Irish and Irish American organizations, and dance performances by the Dorothy Hayden Cudahy's Irish Steppers.

did.physdesc: Photographs documenting Dorothy Cudahy's work at her radio program (including one photograph of James Hayden), and Dorothy and John Cudahy's involvement in social organizations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of greeting cards, newspapers, material objects, and ephemera collected by Dorothy Hayden Cudahy. Of note is the football from the 1947 Cavan-Kerry All-Ireland Senior Football Championship held at the Polo Grounds in New York City.

did.unittitle: Cavan-Kerry football: All-Ireland Finals, Polo Grounds, New York
did.physdesc: Football is located in plexi-glass box in stacks.

did.unittitle: Shamrock Decoration from Danny Devlin's Tuxedo Ballroom
St. Patrick's Day Parade Grand Marshall Sashes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of approximately 1,200 33 rpm and several hundred 78 rpm albums collected by Dorothy Hayden Cudahy and John Cudahy for the Irish Memories radio program. The albums were acquired directly from the artists or purchased during trips to Ireland. The 33 rpm LPs in the collection include recordings made in New York, Boston, and other parts of North America, in addition to some made in Dublin but pressed in New York. A wide variety of Irish music is featured, including both domestic and international artists, and ranging from sean nos singing, ceili bands, show bands, and popular songs. Traditional music, for example, ranges from performances in Ireland to the recordings of its proponents who emigrated to the United States. Because many musicians produced their own albums or those of other musicians, the collection documents Irish musicians' mobility and their ability to assemble in different arrangements over the decades. Illustrated record jackets provide a collection of images, originating both in Ireland and the United States, targeted for Irish American consumption. Liner notes and sleeves offer information on performers, especially on some of the less documented traditional artists, such as Felix Doran, "The Last of the Traditional Pipers."

Musicians and musical groups represented in the collection include The McNulty Family, the Gallowglass Ceili Band, the Tulla Ceili Band, the Clancy Brothers, the Boys of the Lough, the Bothy Band, Clannad, the Chieftains, and the Wolfe Tones. Some of these groups incorporate Celtic and American folk elements into the traditional form. Individual artists include John McCormack, Michael Coleman, Willie Brady, Delia Murphy, Anne Greehy, Michael O'Duffy ( 1959-1970), Birdie Gallagher, Carmel Quinn, Teres Duffy, Ruby Murray, Frank Patterson, Connie Foley, Mary McGonigle, Dermot O'Brien, Jackie Roche (1957-1974) and Paddy Noonan. Of particular interest are a collection of Comhaltas Ceoltoiri Eireann tours of the United States and Canada, circa 1972-1989 (incomplete); two tribute albums to President John F. Kennedy (including his address to Dail Eireann); and the albums of various New York Emerald Society Pipe bands.

physdesc.extent: 19 boxes of 33 rpm records collected by Dorothy Hayden Cudahy and John Cudahy for the Irish Memories Radio Show.

did.unittitle: Series VI. Irish Memories Radio Program Recordings, 1944-1997

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This series consists of cds and cassette tapes of the Irish Memories radio program. The weekly program, began by James Hayden and continued by Dorothy Hayden Cudahy following his death, consisted of musical selections, news, advertisements, interviews, and other segments. Information regarding specific playlists, sponsor announcements, and other show notes can be found in Series I whereas information on particular musical artists can be found in Series IV.
